title.narrative: Preparatory project for the Energy Facilitated Marketplace in West Africa

description.narrative: The Energy Facilitated Marketplace (EFMP) has been designed to address the twin problems of energy deficient centres of local agri-business and poor supply chain infrastructures prevalent in African marketplaces. The initiative will remodel the Municipal Marketplace in Sub-Saharan Africa, testing the hypothesis that combining smart green mini grid and aquaponics farming techniques, powered by green technologies, reduces post-harvest waste and loss by up to 50%. This innovation has been thought through to stimulate investment into output markets and support market incentives for value addition, while encouraging third-party investment into modernizing marketplaces and value chain infrastructures. The design of this initiative which has already been undertaken is expected to transform the local economy and contribute to wider social impacts. This includes creating local jobs, raising incomes of small-scale food producers and stall holders, increasing food production, improving public health and educational opportunities and realizing the productive use of energy for rural development. With this background, CAFOD and KADDRO are hiring the services of professional expertise of Community Development Specialist and Coordinator, Chief Technical Adviser and Mzuzu University in Malawi to undertake rigorous research to unearth current situational context and community dynamics in Sierra Leone and Liberia for appropriate adaptation of the EFMP in West Africa. The findings from the research will help to facilitate the development of the proposal with informed information and data evidence. The entire contract period to undertake the said research will span from the 1st - 31st March, 2021. The hired professional expertise will contract the services of 8 Enumerators to roll out the structured questionnaires for 800 respondents in the two programme's countries. Data will be collected via KoboCollect and analysed through SPSS to generate both quantitative and qualitative data.
